title: Contributory Parent (Temporary) visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Contributory Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 173), a temporary visa allowing eligible parents of settled Australian citizens, permanent residents, or eligible New Zealand citizens to stay in Australia for up to two years. It outlines eligibility requirements, costs, conditions, application procedures, and related visa options.

visa_details.description: A temporary visa that allows a parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen to stay temporarily in Australia.
visa_details.entry_conditions: Multiple entries permitted within the 2-year visa period
notes: From 2 April 2025, applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 can import their paper applications into ImmiAccount after lodgement.
Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported.

what_you_can_do: Live in Australia for up to 2 years
Work and study in Australia (government support not provided)
Apply for a permanent Contributory Parent visa (subclass 143)

must_have: An eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen
Compliance with all applicable visa conditions and Australian law
cannot_have: Previously applied for or currently hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 870)
additional_notes: Family members included must meet health and character requirements.
Non-migrating family members may also be required to meet health and character requirements.

additional_costs: Additional charges for each family member applying
references: See Fees and charges for other services

apply_from.in_australia: Applicant and any applying family members must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance.
apply_from.outside_australia: Applicant and any applying family members must be outside Australia.
apply_from.no_further_stay_condition: If applying while holding a visa with this condition, the application is invalid unless a waiver is granted.

processing_times.general_note: Demand is greater than available places; processing is lengthy.
processing_times.queueing: Applications are subject to capping and queueing and are processed in order of receipt.
delays_possible_if: Application is incomplete or incorrectly filled
Documents missing or additional information is required
processing_times.payment_requirement: Application cannot be processed without correct visa application charge.

assessment_stages: Initial assessment to check eligibility and queue placement or refusal
Final assessment when a place becomes available
instructions: Do not arrange permanent stay until visa is granted.
Decision will be provided in writing.

stay_and_travel.travel_conditions: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia during the 2-year visa period

requirements: All family members must be listed whether migrating or not
family_members.newborn_child_policy: Specific instructions apply if a child is born after application

obligations.entry_requirement: Must enter Australia before the date specified in the grant letter
obligations.legal_requirements: Must obey Australian laws and meet all visa conditions

notes: May be processed faster but costs more.
Costs more than applying directly for subclass 143, but cost is spread over time
Allows stays up to 3 or 5 years at a time

important_updates: From 2 April 2025, certain Parent visa subclasses can import paper applications into ImmiAccount.
